newsitem.title: UK: Aluminium downstream costs should not be LME-based.
newsitem.headline: Aluminium downstream costs should not be LME-based.

text.p: The aluminium industry should not link the price of downstream products to the London Metal Exchange (LME) price, Henk Vrins, Board member of Koninklijke Hoogovens NV said.

In recent years the aluminium industry has gone from one extreme to another by moving from a producer price to relating metal, semi-fabricated and even raw materials to as volatile an indicator as the LME quote, Vrins said.

"The Metal Exchange is an excellent institution for trading marginal physical metal, for hedging price risks, for investors and even for pricing metal transactions within the industry," he said in a speech prepared for delivery at the Financial Times World Aluminium Conference.

However, the industry should think twice about bothering its customers with price volatility which neither they or their own customers understand, and which usually does not bear any relation to price fluctuations of alternative materials, he added. --London Newsroom 44 171 542 8080
